chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime
Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant James J Kettleson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
Huber / work release granted for any purpose the Law allows.

Submit DNA sample.
Register as a sex offender.
No contact with anyone <18 except incidental contact, without Agents approval.
Allowed computer usage for work purposes and e-mails if disclosed to Agent.
Any treatment or counseling recommend, to include Sex Offender Treatment.
Follow all standard rules of probation.

timeConds.notes:
3 days sentence credit to apply.
Defendant may transfer to another jail if accepted.

records.addlTxt: PSI completed and reviewed by all parties.  Correction/perception made by Attny Robinson.  So noted by the Court.  Arguments as to penalty made by both attorneys.  Defendant apologizes for his actions.  Court makes a statement and orders:  Withheld Sentence, 5 years probation with conditions.  Citizenship, voting, and/or firearms information provided.  Appeal rights.
letter from Judge Kussel - to Attorney Robinson - PSI report
of  Frank Cummings, PhD

Attny Robinson addresses the Court.  Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights submitted.  Dr. Cummings report filed.  Plea agreement to amend charge and amended information received.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to amended charge.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  Court orders a PSI with a psychosexual evaluation.
